page.title: 06HEALTH IN TEDSTONE DELAMERE
page.content: Most people living in this area are farmers or workers on the land and therefore working out of doors most of the time. As a result they appear to be long-lived reaching the 80's or 90's. The main calls for medical treatment are accident, childbirth or illnesses connected with old age. The nearest Doctors Surgery is at Knightwick 3 miles SE of the area, with two Doctors in attendance, they hold two surgeries each weekday, and one on Saturday. There is also a surgery twice a week at Clifton.This service is under the National Health Scheme. Expectant mothers travel to Worcester and accident victims will be transported by ambulance either to Worcester or Hereford. If hospitalisation is required patients will be taken into one of the 3 hospitals in Worceter.
